content:
Hi,
so I'm wokring with sublime and a terminal. I'm compiling everything with lake build. When using simp as a tactic I would love to see to what the goal has been simplified to. Is there a way to log that before it fails to compile because the goal is not reached? regards
The behavior you're asking for comes for free if you use VSCode (or emacs or vim, IIRC).
I don't think anyone has written a plugin for sublime text.
yeah sure but maybe a way to print it in the Terminal, (std out)
The goal state should be part of the error message
But Lean is very much intended to be used with more than just stdout available.
